result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron D. Templeton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Fulltime employment/fulltime schooling or combination thereof, or any week that status is not held, defendant must perform 10 hours of Community Service per week.  Any training that is required for any job in his field will be considered as working and will not require the 10 hours Community Service per week.
AODA and any follow up as recommended
AODA and any follow up as recommended

Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

Case Called: 9:40 am 
INCLUDES 13CM2142, 14CF209, 14CM37, 14CM371, AND 14CM378. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person with Atty Thomas Roley. 
Date and time set for motion re: jail credit. 
Atty Roley notes he has not filed a written motion as he has not been able to come to the same conclusion as his client re: 14CF209. 
Atty Roley states deft believes jail has applied the credit in 14CF209 to a different file and states intent to speak with jail administrator. 
Parties note JOCs do reflect credit owed to the deft accurately. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT sets calendar call on 4/22/2015 at 1pm to give Atty Roley a chance to speak with Jail re: credit. 
Deft makes request regarding huber.
COURT will allow huber if def qualifies under jail criteria to go to NA or AA meetings.

COURT ORDERS: 
>>14CF209>>Ct. 3 - 120 days MCJ w/huber if defendant is eligible under jail classification system w/credit for 60 days of time already served.; CC - to be paid within 60 days or payment plan set up in COC.

>>ALL OTHER COUNTS>>Sentence W/held on each count; 3 Years Probation on each count, concurrent to each other.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; AODA and any follow up as recommended; FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or any week that status is not held, defendant must perform 10 hours of C.S. per week -- any training that is required for any job in his field will be considered as working and will not require the 10 hours c.s/week; CC - any offense predating 1/1/14 DNA surcharge is remitted.
